thread.title: Jose Mourinho says climbing Premier League is "very difficult" as he bemoans Man United's fixture congestion
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho says climbing Premier League is "very difficult" as he bemoans Man United's fixture congestion

author: Jake Polden
title: Jose Mourinho says climbing Premier League is "very difficult" as he bemoans Man United's fixture congestion
text:
Sport Jose Mourinho says climbing Premier League is "very difficult" as he bemoans Man United's fixture congestion The Reds Devils are competing in both domestic cup competitions as well as the Premier League and Europa League Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jose Mourinho says climbing Premier League is "very difficult" Share this video Get Chelsea FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Jose Mourinho has admitted that Manchester United competing in a number of cup competitions has made the club's title challenge "very difficult" this season. 
The Portuguese, who on Thursday night guided his team to the EFL Cup final with a 3-2 aggregate victory over Hull City, was speaking about his February fixture list after the game. 
He explained that while the extra matches are good, because it means they are doing something right, they have made United's mission to climb the Premier League much harder. 
The Red Devils, whose game with rivals Manchester City on February 26 will now be rescheduled so they can play Southampton in the EFL Cup final, have six fixtures next month. Jose Mourinho has spoken out about Manchester United's fixture congestion (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) 
In amongst their Premier League games, they play St Etienne home and away in the Europa League - the second leg in France coming just four days before their trip to Wembley. 
Speaking about the juggling act in the above video, Mourinho said: "It's very difficult, now we have a problem already, which is the fact that we don't play Manchester City when we should and then we play Europa League. 
"Europa League is not like the Champions League, with four fixtures for two matches, in the Europa League case, if you progress, it's four fixtures for four matches. The Red Devils progressed to the final of the EFL Cup with an aggregate win over Hull City (Photo: REUTERS) United are also competing to win the Europa League this season (Photo: Manchester United/Getty Images) 
"The week before the final with Southampton, we will prepare for the final by playing at St Etienne in the second leg of the Europa League. 
"If we progress in the FA Cup, another round will come. It's really difficult for us, but it is difficult for good reasons and the good reasons are we progress in competitions." poll loading Will Manchester United win the Europa League this season? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
